summary: PTZ Camera MCP Server Development and Integration

content.text: I see you want me to continue. Let me check the current todo list and project status to understand what work should be resumed.

content.content: Remember to continue to use update and read from the todo list as you make progress. Here is the current list: []

content.text: Based on the CLAUDE.md context, the Camera MCP Server implementation is complete and ready for testing. Let me test it with Claude Code.

input.description: Add Camera MCP Server to Claude Code

content.content: Added stdio MCP server camera_mcp with command: python3 /Users/j/Code/mcp/camera_mcp_server.py to local config

toolUseResult.stdout: Added stdio MCP server camera_mcp with command: python3 /Users/j/Code/mcp/camera_mcp_server.py to local config

content.text: Camera MCP Server successfully added! The server is now available for testing the full workflow: list cameras → control PTZ → take screenshot.

input.description: List installed MCP servers to verify camera_mcp is active
Check if Claude Code has mcp commands available

content.content:
--mcp-debug                     [DEPRECATED. Use --debug instead] Enable MCP
                                  debug mode (shows MCP server errors)
  --dangerously-skip-permissions  Bypass all permission checks. Recommended
                                  only for sandboxes with no internet access.
  --allowedTools <tools...>       Comma or space-separated list of tool names
                                  to allow (e.g. "Bash(git:*) Edit")
  --disallowedTools <tools...>    Comma or space-separated list of tool names
                                  to deny (e.g. "Bash(git:*) Edit")
  --mcp-config <file or string>   Load MCP servers from a JSON file or string
  -c, --continue                  Continue the most recent conversation
  -r, --resume [sessionId]        Resume a conversation - provide a session ID
                                  or interactively select a conversation to
                                  resume
  --model <model>                 Model for the current session. Provide an
                                  alias for the latest model (e.g. 'sonnet' or
                                  'opus') or a model's full name (e.g.
                                  'claude-sonnet-4-20250514').
  -v, --version                   Output the version number
  -h, --help                      Display help for command
--
  mcp                             Configure and manage MCP servers
  migrate-installer               Migrate from global npm installation to local
                                  installation
  doctor                          Check the health of your Claude Code
                                  auto-updater
  update                          Check for updates and install if available

toolUseResult.stdout:

  --dangerously-skip-permissions  Bypass all permission checks. Recommended
                                  only for sandboxes with no internet access.
  --allowedTools <tools...>       Comma or space-separated list of tool names
                                  to allow (e.g. "Bash(git:*) Edit")
  --disallowedTools <tools...>    Comma or space-separated list of tool names
                                  to deny (e.g. "Bash(git:*) Edit")
  --mcp-config <file or string>   Load MCP servers from a JSON file or string
  -c, --continue                  Continue the most recent conversation
  -r, --resume [sessionId]        Resume a conversation - provide a session ID
                                  or interactively select a conversation to
                                  resume
  --model <model>                 Model for the current session. Provide an
                                  alias for the latest model (e.g. 'sonnet' or
                                  'opus') or a model's full name (e.g.
                                  'claude-sonnet-4-20250514').
  -v, --version                   Output the version number
  -h, --help                      Display help for command
--
  mcp                             Configure and manage MCP servers
  migrate-installer               Migrate from global npm installation to local
                                  installation
  doctor                          Check the health of your Claude Code
                                  auto-updater
  update                          Check for updates and install if available

content.text: Let me restart Claude Code to test if the Camera MCP Server tools are available:

input.command: echo "Restarting Claude Code to test Camera MCP Server..."
input.description: Indicate need to restart Claude Code session

content.content: Restarting Claude Code to test Camera MCP Server...

toolUseResult.stdout: Restarting Claude Code to test Camera MCP Server...

content.text: Camera MCP Server is installed. Please restart your Claude Code session to test the new MCP tools. After restart, the camera tools (list_cameras, ptz_control, take_screenshot, get_camera_status) should be available for the full workflow demo.
